title.narrative: Research on Government Secrecy in an Information Age: 2012 Research for the most open and secretive government institutions in Tanzania

description.narrative: The main objectives of the activities is to conduct research on the most open and secretive government institutions in the country aimed at improving democracy accountability and good governance in order to foster social economic development. the activitie s include: preparations of research tools planning missions to the earmarked zones field trips to the selected regions for gathering information and for tools required in the process of gathering and organizing information.The project is implemented by Med ia Institute of Southern Africa (MISA) Tanzania Chapter. MISATAN's emphasis is on extending access to information campaigns whereby civil society organizations and organized communities will be galvanized to utilize access to information to better their so cio economic conditions. However freedom of expression and right to information as enshrined in the article 18 of the Constitution of the United Republic of Tanzania is not fully enjoyed by many. It is within this context that MISATAN is advocating for the independent and pluralistic citizenry.the target groups in this project are, public institutions and private institutions utilizing public funds. The project expects to come up with a well written report that will show which the most open institution is a nd which one is most secretive. Its findings will have a serious outcome in terms of how the government operates and will influence policy making endeavours.
